pageTitle: Heat at Rockets - March 4, 2014 - Game Preview, Play by Play, Scores and Recap on NBA.com
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {3140=8:00 PM ET - Toyota Center, Houston, TX}
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {10687=The Heat's Erik Spoelstra was named East coach of the month for February, and Houston's Kevin McHale won in the West., 10229=Harden had 36 points, a career-high 12 boards and seven assists in a 114-108 loss at Miami last Feb. 6. James and Wade scored a combined 63 in that game., 18640=TURNING POINT: The Rockets took a 13-point lead in the opening minute of the fourth quarter when Jeremy Lin hit a 3-pointer, but Miami stormed back to tie the contest at 89-89 with less than eight minutes remaining. Jones helped steady the ship for Houston by scoring the team's next seven points, including converting a reverse layup while drawing a foul. That three-point play sparked an 11-2 run that put the Rockets ahead 104-95 with 2:37 left., 173420=Copyright © 2015 NBA Media Ventures, LLC. All rights reserved.
